channel.title: WebComponents.org
channel.description: A place to discuss and evolve Web Component best-practices

item.title: 54: Are Web Components Ready Yet?
item.description:
An honest & candid talk about what we learned since the beginning of Web Components; a hard look at the good, the bad, and the ugly. Christian Heilmann (@codepo8), Wilson Page (@wilsonpage), & Rob Eisenberg (@eisenbergeffect) talks with the panel on development with Web Components in today's production environments.

Developers need to to know what they can expect from the future of Web Components & what they mean to us today in order to make better decisions in their choosing technologies for their engineering efforts.

item.title: Polymer 1.0 Review
item.description: After one month of some intense rewrites and migration, The Polymer Podcast team sits down and discusses the road to Polymer 1.0

item.title: Testing Polymer
item.description: The Polymer Podcast panel talks with to Ian MacLeod, core architect behind web-component-tester about testing with Polymer. They also delve into WCT's rich history and tackle some of the harder aspects of testing.

item.title: 48: Web Accessibility in Polymer
item.description: The Web Platform Podcast talks with Chrome team member & Accessibility champion Alice Boxhall and Polymer members, Chris Joel & Daniel Freedman about the Polymer 1.0 and what is new as far as web accessibility of this release as well as what we should expect looking forward.

item.title: 47: X-Tag - The X Generation
item.description: Daniel Buchner talks about the X-Tag project and some if its interesting features. The Web Platform Podcast discusses the Web Component specs and much more. Big companies like Google have thrown their full support behind the Web Components technology umbrella. Will others such as Microsoft follow suit? And what will it take for browser vendors to implement web components natively?

item.title: 46: Polymer 1.0
item.description: Polymer 1.0 is here! Lean mean and production ready. On episode 46 The Web Platform Podcast talks to a Proverbial Packed Panel of Professional Polymer People. Polymer has grown a ton since its developer preview and has been streamlined for performance. It's a a big show with a panel of both GDEâ€™s and members of the Polymer team to get a better idea of just how this project has grown and why Polymer and web components as a whole are important for the modern and future web platform.

item.title: Polymer I/O
item.description: In this episode, the Polymer Podcast panel talks with Taylor Savage, product manager for the Polymer Project, about the announcements at Google I/O and Polymer 1.0. We learn about the Polymer starter kit, the new web component catalogs, and how the polymer team gets things done!

item.title: History of Polymer
item.description: In this episode, we talk with Rob Dodson, developer evangelist for the Polymer Project, about the history of Polymer. We also get to to hear Rob's thoughts on the future of the web and the role Polymer will play in it.

item.title: Web Components with John Rogerson
item.description: Front-end expert John Rogerson offers some practical use cases and draws analogies to web dev approaches we are all already familiar with. John further discusses the pros of web components (modularity, extensibility), the cons (new technology, undefined standards, accessibility) and how they may reflect the future of web development.

item.title: 35: React & Reactive Elements
item.description: Andrew Rota & Denis Radin talk about the ways you can leverage both Web Components & React.js together in a symbiotic fashion. Denis, creator of Reactive Elements, starts us off explaining how his library came to be and why he chose to marry these two technologies in his work. Andrew, who spoke at ReactConf 2015 talks about his experiences with Web Components & React as well.
